news.title: Four arrested after RAF Brize Norton break-in
news.summary: Counter-terrorism police arrest four people after pro-Palestine activists claim they sprayed paint on planes.

news.title: Lyse Doucet: Tehran is coming back to life, but its residents are deeply shaken
news.summary: As Iran's capital resumes its old rhythms, the BBC's Lyse Doucet meets locals who wonder if peace will last.

news.title: A month into Gaza's new aid system - gunfire and chaos are routine
news.summary: A month into the resumption of aid distribution in Gaza there have been repeated reports of killings, with a BBC Verify analysis of dozens of videos showing chaos and panic as people head to get aid.

news.title: Health alerts come into force ahead of second heatwave
news.summary: The UK could see its hottest day of the year on Monday, as a likely heatwave coincides with Glastonbury and Wimbledon.

news.title: Beaver activists secretly releasing them into wild say they're 'doing God's work'
news.summary: An underground network illegally releases beavers but farmers say it can lead to trouble.

news.title: Man who stabbed wife as she pushed their baby in pram guilty of murder
news.summary: Habibur Masum had tracked his wife to a refuge before stabbing her in the street at least 25 times.

news.title: MrBeast removes YouTube AI tool after backlash
news.summary: The world's most subscribed YouTuber admits he "missed the mark" after releasing the tool last week.

news.title: What are the Pip and universal credit changes?
news.summary: The planned changes to the benefits system will affect future claimants, not current claimants.

news.title: Chris Mason: A hat-trick of U-turns – and this is the most awkward of the lot
news.summary: The BBC's political editor Chris Mason gives his analysis of what the climbdown over the welfare bill means for the prime minister.

news.title: Faisal Islam: How much will changes to disability benefits cost?
news.summary: The changes could cost up to £3bn which will have to come from higher taxes or cuts elsewhere, given the chancellor's self-imposed borrowing rules.
